019package org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager;
020
021import com.google.gson.JsonArray;
022import com.google.gson.JsonObject;
023import com.google.gson.reflect.TypeToken;
024import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiClient;
025import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException;
026import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.apis.ApisApi;
027import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.apis.CustomObjectsApi;
028import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1APIGroup;
029import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1APIResource;
030import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1GroupVersionForDiscovery;
031import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1Namespace;
032import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.models.V1ObjectMeta;
033import io.kubernetes.client.util.Config;
034import io.kubernetes.client.util.Watch;
035import io.kubernetes.client.util.generic.dynamic.DynamicKubernetesApi;
036import io.kubernetes.client.util.generic.dynamic.DynamicKubernetesObject;
037import io.kubernetes.client.util.generic.options.ListOptions;
038import java.io.IOException;
039import java.util.HashSet;
040import java.util.LinkedList;
041import java.util.List;
042import java.util.Set;
043import java.util.logging.Level;
044import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.Constants.VM_OP_GROUP;
045import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8s;
046import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.APP_NAME;
047import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.VM_OP_KIND_VM;
048import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.VM_OP_NAME;
049import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmChannel;
050import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmDefChanged;
051import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.util.GsonPtr;
052import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
053
054/**
055 * Watches for changes of VM definitions.
056 */
057@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
058public class VmWatcher extends AbstractWatcher {
059
060    /**
061     * Instantiates a new VM definition watcher.
062     *
063     * @param componentChannel the component channel
064     */
065    public VmWatcher(Channel componentChannel) {
066        super(componentChannel);
067    }
068
069    @Override
070    protected void startWatching() throws IOException, ApiException {
071        // Get all our API versions
072        var client = Config.defaultClient();
073        var apis = new ApisApi(client).getAPIVersions();
074        var vmOpApiVersions = apis.getGroups().stream()
075            .filter(g -> g.getName().equals(VM_OP_GROUP)).findFirst()
076            .map(V1APIGroup::getVersions).stream().flatMap(l -> l.stream())
077            .map(V1GroupVersionForDiscovery::getVersion).toList();
078
079        // Remove left overs
080        var coa = new CustomObjectsApi(client);
081        purge(client, coa, vmOpApiVersions);
082
083        // Start a watcher thread for each existing CRD version.
084        // The watcher will send us an "ADDED" for each existing VM.
085        for (var version : vmOpApiVersions) {
086            coa.getAPIResources(VM_OP_GROUP, version)
087                .getResources().stream()
088                .filter(r -> VM_OP_KIND_VM.equals(r.getKind()))
089                .findFirst()
090                .ifPresent(crd -> watchVmDefs(crd, version));
091        }
092    }
093
094    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CognitiveComplexity")
095    private void purge(ApiClient client, CustomObjectsApi coa,
096            List<String> vmOpApiVersions) throws ApiException {
097        // Get existing CRs (VMs)
098        Set<String> known = new HashSet<>();
099        for (var version : vmOpApiVersions) {
100            // Get all known CR instances.
101            coa.getAPIResources(VM_OP_GROUP, version)
102                .getResources().stream()
103                .filter(r -> VM_OP_KIND_VM.equals(r.getKind()))
104                .findFirst()
105                .ifPresent(crd -> known.addAll(getKnown(client, crd, version)));
106        }
107
108        ListOptions opts = new ListOptions();
109        opts.setLabelSelector(
110            "app.kubernetes.io/managed-by=" + VM_OP_NAME + ","
111                + "app.kubernetes.io/name=" + APP_NAME);
112        for (String resource : List.of("apps/v1/statefulsets",
113            "v1/configmaps", "v1/secrets")) {
114            @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops",
115                "PMD.AvoidDuplicateLiterals" })
116            var resParts = new LinkedList<>(List.of(resource.split("/")));
117            var group = resParts.size() == 3 ? resParts.poll() : "";
118            var version = resParts.poll();
119            var plural = resParts.poll();
120            // Get resources, selected by label
121            @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidInstantiatingObjectsInLoops")
122            var api = new DynamicKubernetesApi(group, version, plural, client);
123            var listObj = api.list(namespaceToWatch(), opts).getObject();
124            if (listObj == null) {
125                continue;
126            }
127            for (var obj : listObj.getItems()) {
128                String instance = obj.getMetadata().getLabels()
129                    .get("app.kubernetes.io/instance");
130                if (!known.contains(instance)) {
131                    var resName = obj.getMetadata().getName();
132                    var result = api.delete(namespaceToWatch(), resName);
133                    if (!result.isSuccess()) {
134                        logger.warning(() -> "Cannot cleanup resource \""
135                            + resName + "\": " + result.toString());
136                    }
137                }
138            }
139        }
140    }
141
142    private Set<String> getKnown(ApiClient client, V1APIResource crd,
143            String version) {
144        Set<String> result = new HashSet<>();
145        var api = new DynamicKubernetesApi(VM_OP_GROUP, version,
146            crd.getName(), client);
147        for (var item : api.list(namespaceToWatch()).getObject().getItems()) {
148            if (!VM_OP_KIND_VM.equals(item.getKind())) {
149                continue;
150            }
151            result.add(item.getMetadata().getName());
152        }
153        return result;
154    }
155
156    private void watchVmDefs(V1APIResource crd, String version) {
157        try {
158            var client = Config.defaultClient();
159            var coa = new CustomObjectsApi(client);
160            var call = coa.listNamespacedCustomObjectCall(VM_OP_GROUP,
161                version, namespaceToWatch(), crd.getName(), null, false,
162                null, null, null, null, null, null, null, true, null);
163            startWatcher(crd, call,
164                new TypeToken<Watch.Response<V1Namespace>>() {
165                }.getType(), this::handleVmDefinitionChange);
166        } catch (IOException | ApiException e) {
167            logger.log(Level.SEVERE, e, () -> "Problem watching \""
168                + crd.getName() + "\": " + e.getMessage());
169        }
170    }
171
172    private void handleVmDefinitionChange(V1APIResource vmsCrd,
173            Watch.Response<V1Namespace> vmDefStub) {
174        V1ObjectMeta metadata = vmDefStub.object.getMetadata();
175        VmChannel channel = channel(metadata.getName());
176        if (channel == null) {
177            return;
178        }
179
180        // Get full definition and associate with channel as backup
181        var apiVersion = K8s.version(vmDefStub.object.getApiVersion());
182        DynamicKubernetesApi vmCrApi = new DynamicKubernetesApi(VM_OP_GROUP,
183            apiVersion, vmsCrd.getName(), channel.client());
184        var curVmDef = K8s.get(vmCrApi, metadata);
185        curVmDef.ifPresent(def -> {
186            // Augment with "dynamic" data and associate with channel
187            addDynamicData(channel.client(), def);
188            channel.setVmDefinition(def);
189        });
190
191        // Get eventual definition to use
192        var vmDef = curVmDef.orElse(channel.vmDefinition());
193
194        // Create and fire event
195        channel.pipeline().fire(new VmDefChanged(VmDefChanged.Type
196            .valueOf(vmDefStub.type),
197            channel
198                .setGeneration(vmDefStub.object.getMetadata().getGeneration()),
199            vmsCrd, vmDef), channel);
200    }
201
202    private void addDynamicData(ApiClient client,
203            DynamicKubernetesObject vmDef) {
204        var rootNode = GsonPtr.to(vmDef.getRaw()).get(JsonObject.class);
205        rootNode.addProperty("nodeName", "");
206
207        // VM definition status changes before the pod terminates.
208        // This results in pod information being shown for a stopped
209        // VM which is irritating. So check condition first.
210        var isRunning = GsonPtr.to(rootNode).to("status", "conditions")
211            .get(JsonArray.class)
212            .asList().stream().filter(el -> "Running"
213                .equals(((JsonObject) el).get("type").getAsString()))
214            .findFirst().map(el -> "True"
215                .equals(((JsonObject) el).get("status").getAsString()))
216            .orElse(false);
217        if (!isRunning) {
218            return;
219        }
220        var podSearch = new ListOptions();
221        podSearch.setLabelSelector("app.kubernetes.io/name=" + APP_NAME
222            + ",app.kubernetes.io/component=" + APP_NAME
223            + ",app.kubernetes.io/instance=" + vmDef.getMetadata().getName());
224        var podList = K8s.podApi(client).list(namespaceToWatch(), podSearch);
225        podList.getObject().getItems().stream().forEach(pod -> {
226            rootNode.addProperty("nodeName", pod.getSpec().getNodeName());
227        });
228    }
229}
